label: ABC_tI48_120_abe_i_i-001
title: $\alpha$-MgAgSb Structure
comments:
MgAgSb is found in three forms (Kirkham, 2012; Mi, 2017): \begin{itemize} \item $\alpha$-MgAgSb (this phase), the tetragonal ground state phase. \item $\beta$-MgAgSb takes on the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC_tP6_129_c_a_c-001}{matlockite ($E0_{1}$ structure}, which can be considered as a ternary form of \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tP6_129_ac_c-001}{Cu$_{2}$Sb ($C38$)}. \item $\gamma$-MgAgSb is in the cubic \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC_cF12_216_a_c_b-001}{half-Heusler ($C1_{b}$)} structure. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The range of stability of these structures is rather uncertain.  The $\alpha$-phase exists below 300$^{\circ}$C, the $\beta$-phase is observed in the range 300-395$^{\circ}$C, and $\gamma$-MgAgSb is found at all temperatures above 27$^{\circ}$C.
